| A guide:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                       |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [monst.c#line3193](/wiki/Monst.c#line3193 "Monst.c")                                  |

- *This article is about the Tourist quest monster. For a guide on how to succeed in NetHack, see [Standard strategy](/wiki/Standard_strategy "Standard strategy").*

The **guide**, @, is a [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). Like the player and [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [tourists](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)"), they are neutral. They are capable of [arcane spell-casting](/wiki/Monster_spell#Mage_spells "Monster spell").

## Encyclopaedia entry

Guides share their entry with [Twoflower](/wiki/Twoflower "Twoflower"), the [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader").

"Rincewind!"  
Twoflower sprang off the bed. The wizard jumped back,  
wrenching his features into a smile.  
"My dear chap, right on time! We'll just have lunch, and  
then I'm sure you've got a wonderful programme lined up for  
this afternoon!"  
"Er --"  
"That's great!"  
Rincewind took a deep breath. "Look," he said desperately,  
"let's eat somewhere else. There's been a bit of a fight  
down below."  
"A tavern brawl? Why didn't you wake me up?"  
"Well, you see, I - \_what\_?"  
"I thought I made myself clear this morning, Rincewind. I  
want to see genuine Morporkian life - the slave market, the  
Whore Pits, the Temple of Small Gods, the Beggar's Guild...  
and a genuine tavern brawl." A faint note of suspicion  
entered Twoflower's voice. "You \_do\_ have them, don't you?  
You know, people swinging on chandeliers, swordfights over  
the table, the sort of thing Hrun the Barbarian and the  
Weasel are always getting involved in. You know --  
\_excitement\_."

\[ The Colour of Magic, by Terry Pratchett ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.](/images/3/37/Nh364-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.4. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-364}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Guide

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ guide
Difficulty 8
Attacks Weapon 1d6, Spell-casting (arcane)
@ guide
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, Spell-casting (arcane)

Base level 5
Base experience 71
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A guide:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3193
This article is about the Tourist quest monster. For a guide on how to succeed in NetHack, see Standard strategy.

The guide, @, is a Tourist quest guardian. Like the player and player monster tourists, they are neutral. They are capable of arcane spell-casting.

Encyclopaedia entry

Guides share their entry with Twoflower, the quest leader.

"Rincewind!"
Twoflower sprang off the bed. The wizard jumped back,
wrenching his features into a smile.
"My dear chap, right on time! We'll just have lunch, and
then I'm sure you've got a wonderful programme lined up for
this afternoon!"
"Er --"
"That's great!"
Rincewind took a deep breath. "Look," he said desperately,
"let's eat somewhere else. There's been a bit of a fight
down below."
"A tavern brawl? Why didn't you wake me up?"
"Well, you see, I - _what_?"
"I thought I made myself clear this morning, Rincewind. I
want to see genuine Morporkian life - the slave market, the
Whore Pits, the Temple of Small Gods, the Beggar's Guild...
and a genuine tavern brawl." A faint note of suspicion
entered Twoflower's voice. "You _do_ have them, don't you?
You know, people swinging on chandeliers, swordfights over
the table, the sort of thing Hrun the Barbarian and the
Weasel are always getting involved in. You know --
_excitement_."

[ The Colour of Magic, by Terry Pratchett ]

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.
